a.n: Ellyn Rucker: Live in New Orleans

p.k: Ellyn Rucker: Live in New Orleans 1992. Jill Fredrickson. New Orleans, U.S.A.
p.d: Denver-based Ellyn Rucker is one of the finest female singer-pianists around, and this 1992 performance raises the question why she is not a world-wide favourite drawing sell-out crowds, much like a Diana Krall would. Perhaps it is because Ellyn's puts her Bill Evans-like piano improvisations in the spotlight rather than her vocals, as she does on the opening numbers of today's set: "Beautiful Love", "Israel", and "Take the Coltrane". Yet this broadcast leaves ample room for her voice to shine as well, when she scats her inimitable way through a set of standards that include "Up Jumped Spring" and the calypso "Fungi Mamma".
